titleStmt.title: James Riley v. Egbert H. Tucker. Exceptions

bibl.title: James Riley v. Egbert H. Tucker. Exceptions
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Be it remembered that on the 4th judicial day of the Sept. Term 1861 of the District Court of the 2d jud District W.T. the Defendent was brought into Open Court in custody of an officer and that the Grand Jury empannelled sworn and charged on the first days of the Term come into Court and and was by order of the Court discharged in presence of the Defendant and the Court then ordered a Grand Jury to be summoned by the Sheriff of Thurston County which was done orally by the Sheriff and that the times occupied in orally summonings and puttings said Jurys into the Box did not exceed five minutes, and that the Defendant was then called upon at once to make his challenges to the pannel if any be taken

That the Defendant thereupon orally challenged the pannel of Grand Jurors then & there presented to him at the Grand Jury about to be sworn & charged to enquire of offenses against the laws of the Territory, and thereupon requested the Court to grant him sufficient time to prepare his said challenges in writing verified by affidavit as required by law. to the said that the Court might pass upon and determine the sufficiency thereof and in case said challenges to the persons should not be allowed that them the Defendant right to
exscribe his right to challenge the indictment of said Jury before being sworn which request of the Defendant was refused by the Court and did said challenge to the persons disadured by the Court without granting any time to propose said challenges in writing as affidavits and without says hearing as to the sufficing thereof. and said Grand Jury was thereupon immediately sworn and charged.
To all which the Defendant excepted and prays the Court to award this his Bill of Exceptions and to sign and seal the same
Refused as not being in accordance with the facts
C C Hewitt C J and presiding Judge of 2nd Judicial District
